reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI read some bad steam reviews on this game before I had chance to play it so almost asked for a refund but then I figured it was early access and I had already paid in anticipation (I love games like wing commander and tachyon the fringe) of an old school space combat game.  I was actually shocked when I got into the game and was blown away by the scale and feel of the environments.  It definitely feels like early access right now but that's because it is.  You can see this in some of the UI, the AI is predictable and parts of the game aren't accessible yet but the potential is there to see.  One complaint I recall was about there being no content, however that is not what I found and when I checked the hours played of that review, it was under 10 minutes.  I wasn't even flying out of the first hanger in 10 minutes with the database and just hanging around.  Once you get going, this game does have a lot to offer.  I was particularly impressed with the music.  It was not over-bearing and sounds professionally mixed, giving an ambience that set the scene as you controlled your way out of the claustrophic shuttle bay and majestically burst into a huge and artistically displayed zone in space.  One question I asked myself was do I prefer this or Eve:Valkyrie?  Well both seem too different to me.  Eve feels more like a VR experience on rails where Starfighter plays more like a game in VR.  Considering the AAA money and talent that went into Eve:Valkyrie, it says a lot about the indie scene and this developer in particular.  I've no regrets buying this in it's early access state and neither does my son who loved it too.
voteText: 11 of 13 people (85%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Disclosure: I am doing the music for CDF Starfighter.

I am going to try to keep this fairly simple due to the fact that I wrote a massive suggestion that was posted in the Suggestions Forum.  But I will try to simplify it for the sake of this review.

Steam is telling me that I have 0 hours played.  I finally found the time to sit down with the game and played for a solid hour and a half.  The only reason I stopped to be honest was because I needed to give my brain a break from VR.  I haven't even looked through the database content yet.

The quick version is that I had a ton of fun in that hour and a half. The game is very reponsive and beautiful to look at.  Great sense of scale and immersion.  Love the sound assets (non-music).  All in all it's a fun time.  The framework and foundation is very solid.

With that being said the game is in Early Access and there is still a bit of work to be done.  As mentioned I posted a very large write up in the suggestions forum. so if you are interested you should go check it out.

The plus side is that the developer is working to fix issues that people are having, lots of updates and is listening to feedback.  My personal experience was smooth, no bugs or performance issues.  Everything loaded quick and was on point.  Keep in mind that you do need a pretty beefy machine to run VR properly (I am running an AMD FX 6350, 8gb RAM and a 980ti).

With more development in the Early Access phase of this project I think that this title has the potential to be an amazing VR expirence.  Don't count this title out, afterall it's one guy doing the work.

I guess the bottom line is that I had fun and can't wait to see where the game goes from here.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

EDIT

This game is actually a lot of fun.  I had problems with my old card (780ti) but it works great with my  new strix 980.   This game really gives a sense of presence and the scale of the game is great.  I have had a go at most things,  most time spent on scramble which is the most fun.

The game has a lot of detail, there are a few minor bugs and the hud could do with some more work.    The main problem for me is having to start the game 5 or 6 times before it decides to start with my rift.  This game has a lot of potential and I look forward to seeing it progress.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pro tip for oculus users: Launch through Steam VR interface. (Top right VR icon in steam.)

Got VR?  Want to go on exciting missions as a space fighter pilot?  Want to immerse yourself in a fantastically rendered, battle hardened universe, where you are a member of a topflight squad?  Then this game is for you!

This may be indie, but the immersion and the gameplay are top notch!  Works great with my H.O.T.A.S  and I got totally lost in the CDF Database, looking through all the ships and space stations.  Clearly a lot of thought and love has gone into the lore and backstory for this game.

The dev is approachable and is open to feedback and suggestions from the community.  I’m having fun with the game and eagerly awaiting updates - I can see myself losing many hours in the CDF universe as it moves towards a full release title.

Be warned Pilot!  Combat is challenging! o7

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I found the EDIT review - and updating it.  (was thumbs down and negative) but my bad... was VR only.

I didn't know this was VR only. ODDLY - it ran and worked (with issues) in 2D... but that's where the problems were as well as the crude graphics. A week after posting a negative review and getting a refund... my VIVE came and I watched the youtube videos again showing this and I had to try again. WOW it is beautiful. VR HEAD SET REQUIRED! It's one of my favorite VR experiences - even in early access. the rotating astroids are insane and HUGE the since of scale is massive. Though VERY early access - there is a lot to do. I Recommend it highly and can't wait for it to develope. (SO how to change my thumbs down from up!?!?)   OH - I found edit and thumbs up. GET THIS it's an amazing experience and fun even is current form.

EDIT a few days later just updated to 0.54   OMG  It's now worth twice the currently price.  MAJOR UPDATE AND IMPROVEMENTS.  Enough I have to go load it up for more.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Im writing this review after the latest recent update 0.57 and its definitly getting in a good shape now. A crosshair was added for the menus and many bugs were fixed. Of course its still in a very early state, but it gets frequent updates. And it has huge potential.

The game itself is an arcade Sci-fi shooter which mostly concentrates on Action. It can cause nausea but its awesome to feel like your in space, and the sense of scale is very good! the Planets are gigantic and the scenery has some great variety so you wont get bored to soon. Graphics would need some more polish but keep in mind that this is a one-man game, give him credit for that.

In conclusion if you need a quick fix for space shooting in VR, this is a good game to start.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

Wasn’t sure what to expect, but this game is awesome!
DISCLAIMER!
I got a Steam Key from the developer.
HOWEVER, I got it for Beta Testing purposes. I am Beta-testing the Mac version. I will also be naming some cons. I'm not biased ;)

But, since I tried it out on my gaming PC, I thought I might as well leave a review.

On with the review!


First of all, the pros.

Pros:
Good graphics! Because it’s made in Unreal4, that’s to be expected.
Voice acting is surprisingly good ^-^
Quite a few different ships (6 in total)
Cool sound effects
Easy to install! Worked on DK2 very well.
Works well with the Steam Controller.
Each ship is super different. They each have a different HUD, speeds, and sometimes different weapons.
Stealth mode is awesome! You can't see through your windows, but use a black and orange monitor to navigate! And the sounds it make add to the atmosphere!
Mediocre:
Between loading screens, you have the default, endless, white void of the Steam VR set up. Not a real problem, but worth mentioning. This is a problem with SteamVR, not the game.
Cons:
The crosshair is off centre. This might just be because of my set-up, but I’m not too sure.
Sometimes there is a bit of doublevision. Might just be because I am using a DK2.
Some of the ships don't have the Stealth/Scout/Fighting/Flying modes. This might just be because of the type of ship, but it is something I noticed. Makes the Scout/Combat Fighter a bit less interesting.
Crazy fast AI Pilots!
(Update: Aiming is fine. By moving my head down a little, the laser aligned with the crosshair. Hence why I removed that from the cons)

Note to the devs!
The minumum requirements might be able to go down a little, as my GTX970 handelled it easily on highest graphics. But that might require further testing to find out if it can indeed be lowered.



Anyway, I do recommend it.
Right now it’s a  7/10.
With the cons fixed I’ll up it to an 8/10 or a 9/10.
voteText: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Very active developer responsive to user feedback in order to improve their product.

That's nice to see.

I will be returning home over the next 48 hours so i will re-purchase this game and try it on my vive.

Updated review:

I can see their have been a lot of improvements since I first tried this a few months ago.

What's lacking for me:

HOTAS Control.  I use the very popular X-52 Pro and can't use it because currently CDF only works with HOTAS X whatever that is?

NAILS needs to implement custom bindings for joystick rather than setting a number of preset profiles for a few select HOTAS.

It took Eve Valkyrie devs a while to do this and they are a big team.  Hopefully NAILS will figure out how to implement custom mapping of controls other than xbox controller.

There is another single developer game Vector 36 running on Unity engine and that lets the user assign whatever controls to any HOTAS.

The other thing needed I think is better engine sound with low frequency content.  I use a body vibration system that is fed from any low frequencies in games like explosions, engine sounds etc.  The sound in cockpit is currently a bit flat.

There is an increased sense of speed which is good... perhaps even more would be possible.  Elite uses star dust streaking past to give sensation of speed and the speeds look and feel higher (should be able to whizz past asteroids much quicker than currently possible).

I like the improved menus and the cockpit.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My first review of this game was negative, but the changes that have been made by the developer have turned this game around.  My main issue was with nausea* making the game unplayable, but the developer (who has been working very hard to turn this game around) has released a number of updates and I've been able to play for over an hour continiously with no nausea at all.

There is currently a lot of content to explore- different mission types, and playable ships.  The VR scaling is good and you can see the basis of what could be a great game.

There are still some issues of course (early access) but I can now recommend this game, the parts that are currently playable are fun and the developer seems committed to responding to bugs and pushing the game forward.

This could be great game.

(*My Graphics Card is an AMD R9 390 and this now seem to run the game at reasonable frame rates and graphics settings)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Awesome game that needs some real storyline with a good plot and more than just either 4 or 8 fighters incoming.
If the monitor in the main menu that says that this was created by one guy then good work buddy and I really hope that you can make more out of this by making a full length game with many types of opponents and more challenges (the fighters AI is really poor once you figure it out). More variety in weapon and ship customization would also be neat.
Also, to get it to work properly on my HTC VIVE took about 20 mins messing with settings. I am running a 4.2GHZ 8 core proccessor with 16GB DDR3 RAM and a sapphire AMD Radeon 390 GPU.
I had to turn off the shading and the anti-ailiasing and crank the VR setting to about 140 + possibly one or two more things to get a stable, good picture.
The motion sickness goes away after about 5 mins of playing so if you do experience it just persevere.
Praying that you keep up the good work and expand this to be an epic game!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

CDF Starfighter VR was one of the Vive games that I was very excited to have come available at launch.  The draw of a pick up and play space simulator that didn't have a steep learning curve like Elite: Dangerous and wasn't Oculus exclusive like EVE Valkyrie made it a very desirable title for me.

When the game launched at double it's current price point, I held off on purchase as it is an early access title and with just a few maps available, it felt like it may be premature to purchase.

The developer recently lowered the cost to $12.99 so I eagerly picked up the game and gave it a try.  In fact, I gave it a couple of tries.  It just doesn't work for me unfortunately.

The graphics could be great but have tons of glitches and even on a 980Ti, the graphics settings in game do nothing to improve them.  The gameplay, what little there currently is, doesn't deliver much on the promise of a space combat game in the vein of Wing Commander or Freespace.

I'm sadly going to be asking for a refund for this game and am reluctantly leaving this review to recommend that others skip this one.  I'm hoping in the months ahead, the developer keeps at the game and improves it but this isn't even a title ready for early access at this point.  Keep your $12.99 and buy the Elite: Dangerous Arenas game for 2/3 of the price that is much more polished and already has multiplayer dogfights and skirmishes.
